alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 09 at 8:55PM EDT until July 10 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT MONDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey...and Pennsylvania... including the following counties...in northern New Jersey... Hunterdon and Warren. In Pennsylvania...Bucks and Northampton. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 853 PM EDT, local law enforcement was reporting ongoing road flooding and flood waters being slow to recede. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Bath, Harmony, Alpha, Ferndale, West Easton, and Milford. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 65 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 11. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
